question.title: What is a clinical feature that raises suspicion of secondary Raynaud's phenomenon?
question.description: A clinical feature that is commonly associated with secondary Raynaud's phenomenon

option_a.title: Unilateral involvement
option_a.description: Involvement of one hand or foot

option_b.title: Male sex
option_b.description: Presence of male sex as a risk factor

option_c.title: Absence of summer remission
option_c.description: No improvement of symptoms during summer months

option_d.title: Family history of Raynaud's disease
option_d.description: Presence of a family history of Raynaud's disease

correct_option.title: Unilateral involvement
correct_option.description: The correct answer is a single word
